came back and stayed with them. The first half of the winter of 1806, which Nicholas Rost6v spent in Moscow, was one of the happiest, mer- riest times for him and the whole family. Nich- olas brought many young men to his parents' house. Ve'ra was a handsome girl of twenty; Sdnya a girl of sixteen with all the charm of an opening flower; Natdsha, half grown up and half child, was now childishly amusing, now girlishly enchanting.
